keyTakeAways: ICE arrested Radule Bojovic, a police officer in Hanover Park, Illinois, accusing him of being an unlawful immigrant from Montenegro.
Bojovic’s tourist visa expired in 2015, and he remained in the U.S. illegally for 10 years, violating U.S. immigration law.
The arrest occurred during a targeted enforcement action by ICE in Illinois, showing federal immigration operations targeting public officials.
The Hanover Park Police Department previously reported Bojovic’s hiring as part of a training program, with claims of due diligence and background checks.
DHS Assistant Secretary Tricia McLaughlin criticized the hiring of an illegal alien in law enforcement, emphasizing that firearm possession by undocumented individuals is a felony.
Mayor Rodney Craig stated that the village conducted thorough background checks and confirmed Bojovic’s legal work authorization before hiring.
The case raises public debate about the vetting processes for hiring police officers and the integrity of law enforcement agencies in hiring undocumented individuals.
This incident mirrors a similar case from September 2025 where an Iowa school superintendent was also arrested for illegal entry and firearm offenses.

summaryOfNewsArticle: ICE arrested Radule Bojovic, a police officer in Hanover Park, Illinois, accusing him of being an unlawful immigrant from Montenegro who overstayed his tourist visa since 2015. Despite claims by Hanover Park officials that due diligence and background checks confirmed his legal work authorization, DHS officials criticized the hiring of an individual living illegally in the U.S. for over a decade, emphasizing that firearm possession by undocumented persons is a felony. The incident has sparked public debate over law enforcement hiring standards and immigration enforcement policies, especially in light of a similar case involving a school superintendent in Iowa. The article underscores the tension between local hiring practices and federal immigration laws.
title: ICE arrests police officer in Chicago suburb and accuses him of being in US illegally
